options.content:
# Phoenix-vNext Observability Lab

Comprehensive benchmarking dashboard for all five OpenTelemetry metric optimization pipelines:

* **Full Pipeline:** Baseline with minimal processing (truth source)
* **Optimized Pipeline:** Adaptive filtering that switches between Moderate mode (<300 series) and Ultra mode (>450 series)
* **Experimental Pipeline:** Research-grade space-saving Top-K selection techniques
* **Hybrid Pipeline:** Combined optimization strategies
* **Observer Pipeline:** Controls optimization mode based on metrics load

panels.description: Shows the current optimization mode and thresholds
panels.title: Current Optimization Mode

panels.description: Shows the reduction percentage for each pipeline compared to Full Pipeline
panels.title: Size Reduction

panels.description: Shows the current time series count and threshold levels
panels.title: Active Time Series

panels.description: Shows the signal quality percentage for optimized pipeline
panels.title: Signal Quality

panels.description: Detailed metrics comparison table for all five pipelines
panels.title: Pipeline Metrics Comparison

panels.description: Time series counts for all pipelines with optimization thresholds
panels.title: Time Series Count by Pipeline

panels.description: Signal quality retention percentage by pipeline
panels.title: Signal Quality Retention by Pipeline

panels.description: Cost reduction percentage by pipeline compared to Full Pipeline
panels.title: Ingest Cost Reduction

panels.description: Signal quality vs cost reduction matrix for all pipelines
panels.title: Pipeline Efficiency Matrix (Quality vs Cost)

panels.description: CPU usage rate over time for stress workloads and different pipelines
panels.title: CPU Usage by Pipeline

options.content: This consolidated dashboard provides a unified view of all five pipeline configurations in the Phoenix-vNext observability lab. Each pipeline uses different OpenTelemetry optimization strategies to balance metric fidelity against ingest costs and resource usage.
